captions.text:
Welcome to How To Cook That I am Ann Reardon
Today we are making cute emoji cheesecakes.

There have been so many requests fro emoji
and there have also been lots and lots of
requests for another give away. So

today we are giving away 12 Breville scraper
mixer pros. We are giving them away to the

top 12 countries that watch How To Cook That
the most. So if you want you country included

next time you're going to have to tell all
your friends about how to cook that and get

it included.
So we have one of these for Australia

one fro USA, New Zealand
Canada, South Africa, Malaysia

Singapore, Philippines, Hong Kong
Mexico, United Arab Emirates (UAE)

And UK now in the UK Breville is called Sage
Appliances so you'll get the same mixer just

branded differently.
And so 12 Breville scraper mixer pros and

I'll tell you at the end of this video how
you can enter that to win one of those.

To make our emoji cheesecakes first all we
want to make our cheesecake base. So just

take some sweet biscuits which ever ones you
like and place them into a bag and then just
bash them with a rolling pin.

All the recipe quantities are on the website
howtocookthat.net and I’ll link to that
in the description below.

Then tip all of your crumbs into the melted
butter and mix it well. It just stirs quite

easily it just makes the crumbs nice and moist
so that they will stick together when they

are in the base of our cheesecakes.
Now that is mixed in we want to cover our

containers. Now I am using containers with
a loose base as you can see.

So because when you bake cheesecakes they
need to be baked in a water bath. So they

don't get too hot and make the cheesecake
crack. We want to cover this with foil so

that none of the water gets in there.
So just take a piece of foil place it over

the top and squash it right down so it covers
the sides and make sure that it is coming

up to the top on each side so that we don't
get any water going in to our cheesecakes.
And then put the base back in the bottom.

So once we've covered each of those we want
to put the crumbs in the base of each one.

And if you use a scoop then you can get that
amount even in each one so that your bases
have the same sort of straight line.

Once you've done that take something flat.
I am just using a bottle and just squash down
those crumbs so that it looks nice and flat.

Now to make our cheesecake filling. What we
need is some cream cheese. We've got block

cream cheese. Some sugar we've got 2 eggs
plus one egg yolk, cream and I get lots of

questions about cream. You want any cream
that is about 35% fat so in the US I think

that is called heavy cream. Here in Australia
pure cream, thickened cream any of those are

fine. And some flour, plain or all=purpose
flour, some yellow food colouring and also

some vanilla and a teaspoon measure for that.
So first of all we ant to tip our cream cheese

and our sugar into the bowl of our electric
mixer. Ad the sugar in and then we want to

mix that on medium speed until it is nice
and soft. And the scraper mixer on this does

a pretty fast job of doing that.
OK once that is mixed an looking creamy and

yummy we are just going to swap over to our
whisk attachment so just scrape all that off.

If you've got some little ones in the house
they might like to lick that clean for you.

Push and twist that one on. Now we want to
add in all the rest of our ingredients. So

add in your eggs with the extra egg yolk,
the cream, the flour and our vanilla. Now

we just want a couple of teaspoons. Just gives
it that nice vanilla flavour to it. I am not

using vanilla that has the seeds in it because
we don't want those little black dots in our

emoji faces we want it to be just plain. Then
just turn that on to whisk again [mixing]

That looks great nice and fluffy now just
add in your yellow gel food colouring and

you don't have to add gel food colouring if
you just want them to be cream or if you don't
want to add colour you don't have to.

Lovely we've got that beautiful emoji yellow
cheesecake mixture.

Now you could just spoon that into your containers
but if we do that it is going to be hard to

get the tops exactly flat, whihc we want it
flat for the nice faces so what I'm going

to do is put it into a piping bag and then
from there we can pipe it into each of them.

Which will just make it easy to get it nice
and neat and not on the edges of the bowl.

So once that is full just put it over the
bowl so you don't get it all over the bench.

Give it a shake to get rid of any air bubbles.
And then just twist the top to stop the mixture

coming back out of the top.
Now what we want to do it just take each one.

Put it down low and just squeeze and go around
in a circle until it is about that full about

3/4's full. Once you've filled them all what
you want to do next is give it a shake and

a bang on the bench. Ands again the reason
we want to do that is because we want it nice

and smooth on top.
Place them all into a large baking dish.

Then carefully pour in some hot water only
to about half way up the sides. Being careful

not to get any on the cheesecakes.
Having it in a water bath just keeps it at

a consistent temperature and makes it not
go hotter than the temperature of the water.

So the water obviously can't go over 100 degrees.
So we will put that in our oven and we'll

leave them in there for about 15 minutes.
We need to keep an eye on them because you

don’t want them to browned on top we want
them nice bright yellow.

So melt some chocolate and put it into a piping
bag. I am using compound chocolate today so

you don't have to worry about tempering it.
And then just print out your template and

I'll put this on the website in the size that
I am using for this dessert. If you are making

your cheesecakes in a different size then
you may need to enlarge it or make it smaller.

then just put some non-stick baking paper
over the top.

And then just outline the little patterns
for the eyes and the mouth. The advantage

of doing it onto some paper instead of directly
onto the dessert is if you make a mistake

you can just make it again. So it doesn't
matter you haven't stuffed up your dessert.

You could also just make heaps of these and
serve these to the table and let your guests

make their own emoji cheesecakes.
So what you do once you've outlined it is

you just give it a little shake like that
and it gets rid of all those little lines

and makes it smooth. Fo your coloured part
of your emoji's you can wither use coloured

candy melts or you can use white chocolate
and then just mix in some oil based food colouring

into it to make it the colours you want. With
your heart emoji's outline them in your normal

chocolate first and then fill them up with
the red so you get that nice border on the

outline. And then just like you did before
give them a little shake just to smooth out

the top. Perfect.
Once they are cooked take them out of the

oven and let them cool.
So then just take the foil off. Place it on

top of something small and gently just push
down on the sides and there you have your

cheesecake. And then just transfer that onto
your serving platter.

So now our cheesecakes are baked and cooled
all we need to do it lift up these little

pieces of chocolate and place them carefully
on top so we've got our little sad face. going

on top of this one. I like the happy ones
better. Which ones your favourite emoji? I

probably use the happy face more than anything
else. There we go these make such a cute dessert.

And now you want to know how you can win one
of the Breville scraper mixer pros. As I said
we've got 12 to give away.

What you need to do is find this little blackboard.
It appears four times in the video and each

time it has a different word in it. And you'r
going to need those four words. SO to enter

what you have to do is number 1 write down
your country and number 2 in 25 words or less

you can write whatever you like as long as
it includes those for words. So it could be

a song it could be a poem it could just be
2 sentences. What every you want as long as

it includes the four words. it is 25 words
or les and you put your country at the start

so we know where you are from. So go ahead
enter here on youtube in the comments below

or on the entry page on the How To Cook That
website. And I'll link to that in the description
below.
[music by setsail used with permission]

title: EMOJI CHEESECAKE RECIPE How To Cook That Ann Reardon
